sentence.Network_en: Malvolio becomes, in default of competition, the play's moral centre.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为没有与其竞争者，马伏里奥自然成了该剧的道德核心。

sentence.Network_en: Charlton are about to play an important away match.
sentence.Network_cn: 查尔顿队即将在客场进行一场重要比赛。

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister has promised that Israel will play a constructive role.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相承诺以色列将发挥积极的作用。

jx.jx_en_mean: To cooperate or pretend to cooperate
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与…合作：与…合作或假装与…合作

lj.lj_ly: decided to play along with the robbers for a while.

jx.jx_en_mean: To do or take part in half-heartedly.
To replay (a recently recorded tape, for example).
jx.jx_cn_mean: 重放：重播放（例如刚录下的磁带）

jx.jx_en_mean: To minimize the importance of; make little of
jx.jx_cn_mean: 贬低：降低…的重要性；贬低

lj.lj_ly: played down the defect to protect the troops' morale.
lj.lj_ls: 把缺点轻描淡写以保护军队的士气

jx.jx_en_mean: To set (one individual or party) in opposition to another so as to advance one's own interests
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使相斗（以坐收渔利）：将（一个人或一个队）置于与另一个（人或队）相对的位置从而加强自己的利益

lj.lj_ly: a parent who played off one child against another.
lj.lj_ls: 让一个孩子与另一个孩子相斗的家长

jx.jx_en_mean: To take advantage of (another's attitudes or feelings) for one's own interests
jx.jx_cn_mean: 利用：为自己的利益利用（别人的态度或感情）

lj.lj_ly: demagogues who play on popular fears.
lj.lj_ls: 煽动者利用了公众的恐惧

lj.lj_ly: Our strength was played out early in the contest.
lj.lj_ls: 比赛中我们的力量早已耗尽了

lj.lj_ly: She played up her experience during the employment interview.
lj.lj_ls: 在雇用面试时她强调了她的经验

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（试图）吸引，勾引；（试图）达到，得到

jx.jx_en_mean: draw attention to in an ostentatious manner, typically to gain prestige or advantage
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为取得声望或优势）故意卖弄，大肆炒作

lj.lj_ly: the company made great play of their recent growth in profits.
lj.lj_ls: 该公司大肆炒作其最近的利润增长。

phrase.cizu_name: not playing with a full deck

jx.jx_en_mean: perform music without having to read from a score

means.word_mean: 进行...,专心于,沉溺于,努力
跳动,闪动,步态,姿势,生活作风

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English pleg(i)an 'to exercise', plega 'brisk movement', related to Middle Dutch pleien 'leap for joy, dance'

encyclopedia.content: 专辑介绍基本信息 专辑名称 PLAY 演唱歌手 安室奈美惠 唱片公司 Avex Trax 发行日期 2007-6-27 专辑语种 日语专辑曲目曲目 01 HIDE & SEEK 02 Full Moon 03 CAN'T SLEEP,CAN'T EAT,I'M SICK 04 It's all about you 05 FUNKY TOWN 06 Step With It 07 Hello 08 Should I Love Him？ 09 Top Secret 10 Violet Sauce (Spicy) 11 Baby Don't Cry 12 Pink KeyHIDE & SEEK 作词：Nao'y

entry.def: When children, animals, or perhaps adults play, they spend time doing enjoyable things, such as using toys and taking part in games.

example.ex: ...invite the children round to play...
example.tran: 邀请孩子们来玩

example.ex: They played in the little garden...
example.tran: 他们在小花园里玩耍。

entry.def: When you play a sport, game, or match, you take part in it.

example.ex: While the twins played cards, Francis sat reading...
example.tran: 那对双胞胎玩扑克牌的时候，弗朗西斯坐着看书。

example.ex: Alain was playing cards with his friends...
example.tran: 阿兰正和朋友打扑克牌。

entry.def: When one person or team plays another or plays against them, they compete against them in a sport or game.

example.ex: Northern Ireland will play Latvia...
example.tran: 北爱尔兰队将对阵拉脱维亚队。

example.ex: I've played against him a few times.
example.tran: 我已多次和他交手。

entry.def: When you play the ball or play a shot in a game or sport, you kick or hit the ball.

example.ex: Think first before playing the ball...
example.tran: 踢出球前先想一想。

example.ex: Sikander Bakht played a bad shot...
example.tran: 西坎德尔·巴克特击出一记坏球。

entry.tran: 开（玩笑）；耍（花招）；搞（恶作剧）
entry.def: If you play a joke or a trick on someone, you deceive them or give them a surprise in a way that you think is funny, but that often causes problems for them or annoys them.

example.ex: Someone had played a trick on her, stretched a piece of string at the top of those steps...
example.tran: 有人搞恶作剧整她，在最高的台阶上拉了一根绳子。

example.ex: I thought: 'This cannot be happening, somebody must be playing a joke'.
example.tran: 我想：“这不可能发生，肯定是谁在开玩笑。”

entry.def: If you play with an object or with your hair, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers, perhaps because you are bored or nervous.

example.ex: She stared at the floor, idly playing with the strap of her handbag.
example.tran: 她眼睛盯着地板，漫不经心地摆弄着手提包的带子。

entry.def: A play is a piece of writing which is performed in a theatre, on the radio, or on television.

example.ex: The company put on a play about the homeless...
example.tran: 这家剧团上演了一出讲述无家可归者的戏。

example.ex: It's my favourite Shakespeare play.
example.tran: 它是我最喜欢的一部莎士比亚戏剧。

entry.def: If an actor plays a role or character in a play or film, he or she performs the part of that character.

example.ex: ...Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde, in which he played Hyde...
example.tran: 他在其中饰演海德一角的《化身博士》

example.ex: His ambition is to play the part of Dracula.
example.tran: 他渴望扮演德拉库拉。

entry.def: You can use play to describe how someone behaves, when they are deliberately behaving in a certain way or like a certain type of person. For example, to play the innocent, means to pretend to be innocent, and to play deaf means to pretend not to hear something.

example.ex: Hill tried to play the peacemaker...
example.tran: 希尔想要充当和事佬。

example.ex: She was just playing the devoted mother...
example.tran: 她只是装得像个尽心尽责的母亲似的。

entry.def: You can describe how someone deals with a situation by saying that they play it in a certain way. For example, if someone plays it cool, they keep calm and do not show much emotion, and if someone plays it straight, they behave in an honest and direct way.

example.ex: Investors are playing it cautious, and they're playing it smart.
example.tran: 投资者审慎精明地行事。

entry.def: If you play a musical instrument or play a tune on a musical instrument, or if a musical instrument plays, music is produced from it.

example.ex: Nina had been playing the piano...
example.tran: 尼娜一直都在弹钢琴。

example.ex: Two people played jazz on a piano...
example.tran: 两人联手在一架钢琴上演奏爵士乐。

entry.def: If you play a record, a CD, or a tape, you put it into a machine and sound is produced. If a record, CD, or tape is playing, sound is being produced from it.

example.ex: She played her records too loudly...
example.tran: 她播放唱片时音量太大了。

example.ex: Every evening in those days the BBC played 'God Save The King'...
example.tran: 那些日子里，英国广播公司每天晚上都会播放《天佑吾王》。

entry.tran: （音乐家、乐队等）表演；举办（音乐会）
entry.def: If a musician or group of musicians plays or plays a concert, they perform music for people to listen or dance to.

example.ex: A band was playing...
example.tran: 乐队在表演。

example.ex: He will play concerts in Amsterdam and Paris.
example.tran: 他将在阿姆斯特丹和巴黎举办音乐会。

entry.def: When light plays somewhere, it moves about on a surface in an unsteady way.

example.ex: The sun played on the frosty roofs.
example.tran: 阳光在结霜的屋顶上闪烁变幻。

entry.tran: 搞什么名堂；干什么蠢事
entry.def: If you ask what someone is playing at, you are angry because you think they are doing something stupid or wrong.

example.ex: What the hell are you playing at?
example.tran: 你究竟在搞什么名堂？

entry.tran: （使）开始活动；（使）投入使用； （使）开始起作用
entry.def: When something comes into play or is brought into play, it begins to be used or to have an effect.

example.ex: The real existence of a military option will come into play...
example.tran: 存在选择军事手段的切实可能这一点将会起到作用。

example.ex: Breathing brings many muscles into play.
example.tran: 呼吸使很多肌肉活动起来。

entry.def: If something or someone plays a part or plays a role in a situation, they are involved in it and have an effect on it.

example.ex: They played a part in the life of their community...
example.tran: 他们参与到了自己社区的生活中。

example.ex: The UN would play a major role in monitoring a ceasefire.
example.tran: 联合国在监督停火方面会发挥重要作用。

means.word_mean: 1. a dramatic work intended for performance by actors on a stage;

sentences.sentence: "he wrote several plays but only one was produced on Broadway"

means.word_mean: 2. a theatrical performance of a drama;
3. a preset plan of action in team sports;

sentences.sentence: "the coach drew up the plays for her team"

means.word_mean: 4. a deliberate coordinated movement requiring dexterity and skill;

sentences.sentence: "the runner was out on a play by the shortstop"

means.word_mean: 5. a state in which action is feasible;

sentences.sentence: "insiders said the company's stock was in play"
"they made a futile play for power"
"he made a bid to gain attention"

means.word_mean: 8. play by children that is guided more by imagination than by fixed rules;

sentences.sentence: "Freud believed in the utility of play to a small child"

means.word_mean: 9. (in games or plays or other performances) the time during which play proceeds;

sentences.sentence: "he gave free rein to his impulses"
"they gave full play to the artist's talent"
"the shimmer of colors on iridescent feathers"
"the play of light on the water"

means.word_mean: 12. verbal wit (often at another's expense but not to be taken seriously);

sentences.sentence: "there was too much play in the steering wheel"

means.word_mean: 14. gay or light-hearted recreational activity for diversion or amusement;

sentences.sentence: "their frolic in the surf threatened to become ugly"

means.word_mean: 15. the act of playing for stakes in the hope of winning (including the payment of a price for a chance to win a prize);

sentences.sentence: "there was heavy play at the blackjack table"

means.word_mean: 16. the activity of doing something in an agreed succession;
17. the act using a sword (or other weapon) vigorously and skillfully

sentences.sentence: "Pele played for the Brazilian teams in many important matches"

means.word_mean: 2. act or have an effect in a specified way or with a specific effect or outcome;

sentences.sentence: "This factor played only a minor part in his decision"
"I played no role in your dismissal"
"She wants to act Lady Macbeth, but she is too young for the role"
"She played the servant to her husband's master"

means.word_mean: 5. be at play; be engaged in playful activity; amuse oneself in a way characteristic of children;

sentences.sentence: "The kids were playing outside all day"
"I used to play with trucks as a little girl"
"She played the third movement very beautifully"
"Can you play on this old recorder?"

means.word_mean: 8. pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind;

sentences.sentence: "She plays deaf when the news are bad"

means.word_mean: 9. move or seem to move quickly, lightly, or irregularly;
11. engage in recreational activities rather than work; occupy oneself in a diversion;
12. pretend to be somebody in the framework of a game or playful activity;

sentences.sentence: "the stereo was playing Beethoven when I entered"
"The prodigy played Carnegie Hall at the age of 16"
"She has been playing on Broadway for years"

means.word_mean: 15. put (a card or piece) into play during a game, or act strategically as if in a card game;

sentences.sentence: "He is playing his cards close to his chest"
"The Democrats still have some cards to play before they will concede the electoral victory"

means.word_mean: 16. engage in an activity as if it were a game rather than take it seriously;

sentences.sentence: "They ran the tapes over and over again"

means.word_mean: 19. manipulate manually or in one's mind or imagination;

sentences.sentence: "She played nervously with her wedding ring"
"He played with the idea of running for the Senate"
"She plays with the thought of moving to Tasmania"

means.word_mean: 22. be received or accepted or interpreted in a specific way;

sentences.sentence: "This speech didn't play well with the American public"
"His remarks played to the suspicions of the committee"
"Play about with a young girl's affection"

means.word_mean: 24. cause to move or operate freely within a bounded space;

sentences.sentence: "The engine has a wheel that is playing in a rack"

means.word_mean: 25. perform on a stage or theater;

sentences.sentence: "What's playing in the local movie theater?"
"`Cats' has been playing on Broadway for many years"

means.word_mean: 27. cause to happen or to occur as a consequence;

sentences.sentence: "The rain brought relief to the drought-stricken area"

means.word_mean: 28. discharge or direct or be discharged or directed as if in a continuous stream;
30. stake on the outcome of an issue;

sentences.sentence: "She played all her money on the dark horse"

means.word_mean: 31. shoot or hit in a particular manner;

sentences.sentence: "She played a good backhand last night"

means.word_mean: 33. employ in a game or in a specific position;
34. contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle;
35. exhaust by allowing to pull on the line;

example.en: They pulled off that squeeze play like the professionals they are.
example.zh: 他们的抢分战术运用得很棒，像专球员一样。

list.explanation: 使用不道德、肮脏的或害人的手法，行骗使坏

example.en: When he started in politics he didn't mean to play dirty.
example.zh: 当初他开始进入政界时,并没有打算要使用肮脏卑鄙的手段。

list.explanation: 破坏、毁坏、损害(某人或某事物)，给(某人或某事物)制造麻烦

example.en: If you drive badly, it plays hell with the tyres of your car.
example.zh: 如果你胡乱驾驶，那会损坏你的汽车轮胎。

example.en: Your decision plays hell with all my friends.
example.zh: 你的决定是在给我所有的朋友制造麻烦。

example.en: You shouldn't play hell with me on this matter.
example.zh: 你不应该在这件事上对我大发脾气。

slang.tokens: play fast and loose with somebody

list.explanation: (对待某人或某事物)行为反复无常，处事轻率、忽冷忽热

example.en: He was playing fast and loose with his girlfriend. So she left him.
example.zh: 他对他的女友老是忽冷忽热，于是她离开了他。

auth_sentence.content: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.
auth_sentence.res_content: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.

auth_sentence.content: There's still an unbelievable amount to play for.
auth_sentence.res_content: There's still an unbelievable amount to play for.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's still an unbelievable amount to play for.

auth_sentence.content: But Lustgarten's play is not about high finance.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Lustgarten's play is not about high finance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Lustgarten's play is not about high finance.

means.word_mean: 游戏, 玩耍; 娱乐

sentences.en: All work and no play isn't a good thing.
sentences.cn: 只工作不玩耍不是件好事。

means.word_mean: 比赛, 竞赛, 运动, 赛风, 比赛中的表现

sentences.en: There was some excellent play in yesterday's match.
sentences.cn: 昨天的比赛有些出色的表现。

sentences.en: The college drama society is going to put on a play.
sentences.cn: 大学戏剧协会正准备上演一个剧目。

means.word_mean: 自由活动, 间隙, 活动空间

sentences.en: We need more play on the rope.
He won 1000 pounds in last night's play.
sentences.cn: 他昨天晚上赌博赢了1000英镑。

means.word_mean: 玩, 玩耍, 玩耍, 游戏, 玩乐

sentences.en: The children don't know how to play the game.
sentences.cn: 孩子们不会玩这个游戏。

sentences.en: I'll play you a game of cards.
Our best defender is injured and won't be able to play today.
sentences.cn: 我们最佳的防守员受伤了, 今天不能参加比赛。

means.word_mean: 演奏; 弹拨, 吹奏（乐器）; 播放

sentences.en: He plays the piano surprisingly well.

sentences.cn: 为我们演奏一些快乐的乐曲。

sentences.en: He'd written a tune, and played it to us on the piano.
sentences.cn: 他写了一段曲子, 并在钢琴上弹给我们听。

sentences.en: He played his favourite record for me.
sentences.cn: 他为我放他最喜爱的唱片。

means.word_mean: 演出, 扮演, 假装, 装扮

sentences.en: Don't play jokes on the poor girl.
sentences.cn: 别再开这可怜的女孩玩笑了。

jushi.english: I could hear music playing on the radio.
jushi.chinese: 我听见收音机里演奏着音乐。

jushi.english: The radio is playing too loudly.
Our best defender is injured and won't be able to play today.
jushi.chinese: 我们最佳的防守员受伤了,今天不能参加比赛。
